name: Hydrogen combustion
description: Highly exothermic combustion producing water.

name: Haber process (ammonia synthesis)
description: Primary industrial route to ammonia. ~150 million tonnes/year globally.

name: Steam methane reforming
description: Primary industrial hydrogen production method. Produces syngas.

name: Water-gas shift reaction
description: Converts CO and steam to CO2 and H2. Used after steam reforming.

name: Water electrolysis
description: Green hydrogen production via electrolysis. Growing rapidly for decarbonization.

name: Contact process step 1 (sulfur combustion)
description: First step of the Contact process for sulfuric acid production.

name: Contact process step 2 (SO2 oxidation)
description: Key catalytic step of the Contact process. ~99.5% conversion.

name: Contact process step 3 (oleum formation)
description: SO3 absorbed into concentrated H2SO4 to form oleum (fuming sulfuric acid).

name: Oleum dilution to sulfuric acid
description: Oleum diluted with water to produce concentrated sulfuric acid.

name: Ostwald process step 1 (ammonia oxidation)
description: First step of Ostwald process for nitric acid. ~95% yield with Pt-Rh catalyst.

name: Ostwald process step 2 (NO oxidation)
description: Spontaneous oxidation of nitric oxide to nitrogen dioxide.

name: Ostwald process step 3 (nitric acid formation)
description: Final step producing nitric acid. The NO byproduct is recycled to step 2.

name: Solvay process (overall)

conditions.other: multi-step process using NH3 as intermediate

description: Overall Solvay process for soda ash (Na2CO3). Key step involves NaHCO3 precipitation.

name: Solvay process (key precipitation step)
equation: NaCl(aq) + NH3(aq) + CO2(g) + H2O(l) -> NaHCO3(s) + NH4Cl(aq)
description: NaHCO3 precipitates due to low solubility. Filtered and calcined to Na2CO3.

name: Hall-Heroult process

conditions.other: electrolysis in molten cryolite (Na3AlF6) bath; carbon anodes consumed

description: Primary aluminium smelting. Consumes ~15 kWh per kg Al. Dissolved in cryolite at ~960C.

name: Bayer process (alumina extraction)

conditions.other: digestion of bauxite in hot caustic soda

description: Bayer process extracts alumina from bauxite ore. Precursor to Hall-Heroult.

name: Blast furnace iron smelting (overall)

conditions.other: blast furnace with coke as reductant

description: Primary iron ore reduction. CO generated in situ from coke + hot air.

name: Coke combustion in blast furnace
description: Limited combustion of coke produces CO reductant gas in blast furnace.

name: Basic oxygen steelmaking

conditions.other: pure O2 blown into molten pig iron; removes excess C as CO

description: Basic oxygen furnace (BOF) converts pig iron to steel by blowing O2. ~70% of world steel.

name: Slag formation in steelmaking
description: CaO flux combines with silica impurities to form slag.

name: Chloralkali electrolysis
description: Produces chlorine, sodium hydroxide, and hydrogen simultaneously.

name: Kroll process step 1 (chlorination)
description: Rutile ore converted to titanium tetrachloride. First step of Kroll process.

name: Kroll process step 2 (reduction)
description: Magnesium reduces TiCl4 to titanium sponge. Batch process, very energy-intensive.

name: Copper matte smelting
description: Partial roasting of copper matte in converting furnace.

name: Copper blister formation
description: Self-reduction of Cu2S by Cu2O to produce blister copper (~99% Cu).

name: Copper electrorefining

conditions.other: electrolysis in CuSO4/H2SO4; impure Cu anode, pure Cu cathode; ~0.3V

description: Electrorefining produces 99.99% pure copper. Precious metals recovered from anode slime.

name: Zinc roasting
description: Roasting sphalerite (ZnS) to zinc oxide for subsequent reduction.

name: Zinc smelting (carbothermic reduction)
description: Carbothermic reduction of ZnO. Zinc vapor condensed and collected.

name: Claus process (main reaction)
description: Recovers elemental sulfur from H2S in natural gas/refinery streams. >95% recovery.

name: Frasch process sulfur melting

conditions.other: superheated water (165C) injected underground to melt sulfur deposits

description: Frasch process mines sulfur by melting underground deposits with superheated water.

name: Fischer-Tropsch synthesis (general)
equation: n CO(g) + (2n+1) H2(g) -> CnH(2n+2)(l) + n H2O(g)
description: Converts syngas to liquid hydrocarbons. Used for gas-to-liquids (GTL) and coal-to-liquids.

name: Methanol synthesis
description: Industrial methanol synthesis from syngas. ~100 million tonnes/year globally.

name: Ethylene production (steam cracking)
description: Thermal dehydrogenation of ethane to ethylene. Largest-volume petrochemical.

name: Polyethylene polymerization
description: Polymerization of ethylene to polyethylene. Most-produced plastic globally.

name: Cement clinker formation (limestone calcination)
description: Calcination of limestone. Major source of industrial CO2 emissions.

name: Portland cement clinker (belite formation)
description: Calcium silicate (belite) formation in cement kiln. Key hydraulic phase.

name: Soda-lime glass production
description: Sodium carbonate lowers melting point of silica in glass manufacture.

name: Silicon production (carbothermic reduction)
description: Metallurgical-grade silicon production. Purified further for semiconductor use.

name: PVC production (vinyl chloride)
description: Direct chlorination of ethylene to 1,2-dichloroethane (EDC). Precursor to PVC.

name: Phosphorus production (electric arc furnace)
equation: 2 Ca3(PO4)2(s) + 6 SiO2(s) + 10 C(s) -> P4(g) + 6 CaSiO3(l) + 10 CO(g)

conditions.other: electric arc furnace; P4 vapor condensed under water

description: White phosphorus production from phosphate rock via electric arc furnace.

name: Phosphoric acid production (wet process)
description: Wet-process phosphoric acid for fertilizer production. Gypsum (CaSO4) byproduct.

name: Sodium hydroxide + CO2 (caustic scrubbing)
description: Caustic scrubbing of CO2 from flue gas or process streams.

name: Catalytic cracking (general)
description: Fluid catalytic cracking (FCC) of heavy petroleum fractions into gasoline.

name: Methane combustion
description: Natural gas combustion. Cleanest-burning fossil fuel.

name: Pidgeon process (magnesium production)
description: Pidgeon process: silicothermic reduction of MgO. Dominant in China.

name: Chromium production (aluminothermic)

conditions.other: thermite-type reaction; used for ferrochrome alloy

description: Aluminothermic reduction of chromium oxide for chromium metal production.

name: Urea synthesis
description: Bosch-Meiser process. World's most-produced chemical by mass (~180 Mt/y). Fertilizer.

name: Lithium carbonate to lithium metal
description: Thermal decomposition of lithium carbonate. Precursor to lithium metal electrolysis.

name: Manganese dioxide reduction (ferromanganese)
description: Carbothermic reduction of pyrolusite. 90% of Mn used in steel production.

name: Mond process (nickel purification)

conditions.other: Ni(CO)4 decomposes at 230C to deposit pure Ni; extremely toxic gas

description: Mond process: volatile Ni(CO)4 formed at 50C, decomposed at 230C for 99.99% pure Ni.

name: Lead smelting
description: Roasting of galena (PbS) to lead oxide, then reduced with carbon to lead metal.

name: Tin smelting

conditions.other: reverberatory furnace; one of the oldest smelting processes

description: Carbothermic reduction of cassiterite. Bronze Age technology. Tin used in solder and tinplate.
